text: Thank You blithe Valley you've just been
elected as a new MP you're exhausted
after six weeks of solid campaigning and
then you have to start your new job
straight away and most of your time is
gonna be spent here how do you know
where to even begin well there is some
help
any MP who's been elected for the first
time when they first come to Westminster
they can come here to portcullis house
to this new members reception area this
is the room where they can get all the
answers to any questions as they have
staff in Parliament have been preparing
for their new arrivals so as soon as you
arrive you will be assigned someone
called a buddy and that's a
parliamentary member of staff who will
help you navigate your first day weeks
and even months into the new Parliament
and there are one-stop-shop of
information too yet help you orientate
yourself bamboozled by a maze of
corridors a wide-eyed new MP might be in
need of some peace and quiet we're
better than the serene surroundings of
the beautiful Commons library it's
really special to be able to film in
here this library is only for MPS not
even their staff are normally allowed in
here
MPs that have been here a while and
indeed their staff really value library
services so we look forward to welcoming
them to tell me about our impartial
analysis what we publish our request
service and the resources that are
available to them this is an amazing
space for MPS to use you can imagine the
scene can't you log fire over there
reclining in one of these armchairs just
relaxing getting to know your subject
matter brushing up on parliamentary
debates from hundreds of years ago maybe
writings an odd letter or two on this
lovely head of paper it really is an
incredible resource all that reading
setting off the hunger pangs fear not
new MP there are no fewer than 12
restaurants around Parliament their
kitchens feed more than fourteen
thousand people a day and will surely be
able to cater to any tastes but
ultimately an MP's job is to represent
and to scrutinize and here is where that
happens for any new MP sitting on one of
these green benches in here is surely
what they have always dreamed of and for
the most ambitious among the new intake
they've got their eye on one day
standing here but before that get over
those nerves and prepare for the most
daunting of tasks standing up to speak
here for the first time
you
